controls.name: Context of the Organisation; Scope
controls.description: Context of the Organisation - Understanding the organization and its context, understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties, determining the scope of the ISMS.

controls.name: Leadership and commitment
controls.description: Leadership - Leadership and commitment, information security policy, organizational roles responsibilities and authorities.

controls.name: Planning *Incl Control Test Planning
controls.description: Planning - Actions to address risks and opportunities, information security objectives and planning to achieve them.

controls.name: Support
controls.description: Support - Resources, competence, awareness, communication, documented information.

controls.name: Operation
controls.description: Operation - Operational planning and control, information security risk assessment, information security risk treatment.

controls.name: Performance evaluation - HO Internal Audit
controls.description: Performance Evaluation - Monitoring measurement analysis and evaluation, internal audit, management review.

controls.name: Improvement (continual improvement
controls.description: Improvement - Continual improvement, nonconformity and corrective action.

controls.name: Policies for Information Security - Hlr Aus
controls.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.

controls.name: Policies for Information Security - Hannover Office including CSSA
controls.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.

controls.name: Information Security-Roles and Responsibilties
controls.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organization needs.

controls.name: Information Security- segregation of duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

controls.name: Management Responsibilties (ISMS 27001:2022)
controls.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.

controls.name: Contact with Authorities, incl. APRA Notification
controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

controls.name: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence
controls.description: Information about information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

controls.name: Information Security in Project Management
controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

controls.name: Inventory of information and other associated Assets
controls.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.

controls.name: Acceptable use of information and other associated Assets
controls.description: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.

controls.name: Return of assets
controls.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return all organizational assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

controls.name: Classification of information : Confidentiality, integrity, availabilitey + Privacy
controls.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

controls.name: Labelling of information
controls.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.

controls.name: Information transfer
controls.description: Rules, procedures or agreements for information transfer shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.

controls.name: Access Control
controls.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

controls.name: Identity management
controls.description: The full cycle of identity management shall be implemented.

controls.name: Authentication information
controls.description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.

controls.name: Access Rights
controls.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.

controls.name: Information Security in supplier relationships - Third Parties CPS 234 CO 13
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.

controls.name: Addressing Information Security within supplier agreements   234 vs CPS 230 &100% supplier coverage
controls.description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.

controls.name: Managing information security in the information and communication technology (ICT) supply chain
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.

controls.name: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
controls.description: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.

controls.name: Information security for use of cloud services
controls.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.

controls.name: Information security incident management planning and preparation
controls.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

controls.name: Assessment and descision on information security events
controls.description: The organization shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.

controls.name: Response to information security incidents
controls.description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

controls.name: Learning from information security incidents
controls.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.

controls.name: Collection of evidence
controls.description: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.

controls.name: Information Security during disruption
controls.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

controls.name: ICT Readiness for business continuity *DR and BC testing
controls.description: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.

controls.name: Legal, Statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
controls.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.

controls.name: Intellectual property rights
controls.description: The organization shall protect records from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release in accordance with legislatory, regulatory, contractual and business requirements.

controls.name: Protection of records
controls.description: Privacy and protection of PII shall be ensured as required by applicable legislation, regulations and contractual requirements.

controls.name: Privacy and protection of personal identifiable information (PII)
controls.description: The organization shall regularly review its approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies.

controls.name: Independent review of Information Security - Line 2 Control Testing
controls.description: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.

controls.name: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security * Controls testing
controls.description: Information systems shall be regularly reviewed for compliance with the organization's information security policies, topic-specific policies, rules and standards.

controls.name: Documented operating procedures
controls.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.

controls.name: People controls - screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.

controls.name: People controls - terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: Employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.

controls.name: Information Security awareness, education and training
controls.description: All personnel and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

controls.name: Disciplinary process
controls.description: A formal and communicated disciplinary process shall be in place to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.

controls.name: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
controls.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.

controls.name: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
controls.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.

controls.name: Remote working
controls.description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization's premises.

controls.name: Information Security Event Reporting
controls.description: Personnel shall have a means of reporting observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

controls.name: Physical  Security Monitoring *ISO27001:2022 tbc
controls.description: Physical security monitoring shall be continuously implemented.

controls.name: Technological controls - user end point devices
controls.description: User endpoint devices shall be protected.

controls.name: Privileged access rights
controls.description: Privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

controls.name: Information access restriction
controls.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.name: Access to source code
controls.description: Read, write and execute access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.

controls.name: Secure authentication
controls.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

controls.name: Capacity Management
controls.description: Adequate and redundant information processing facilities shall be implemented to meet availability requirements.

controls.name: Protection from Malware: Home Office Control Effectiveness Framework testing
controls.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

controls.name: Protection from Malware: Patch monitoring/Pen Testing of HLRA-specific items
controls.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

controls.name: Management Technical Vulnerabilities ; Restrictions on installation
controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.

controls.name: Configuration Management
controls.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.

controls.name: Information Deletion
controls.description: Deletion of information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media shall be performed when no longer required.

controls.name: Data Masking
controls.description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.

controls.name: Data Leakage Prevention
controls.description: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.

controls.name: Information Backup
controls.description: Backup copies of information, software and systems shall be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.

controls.name: Redundancy of information processing facilities
controls.description: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.

controls.name: Logging
controls.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.

controls.name: Monitoring Activities
controls.description: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.

controls.name: Clock Synchronisation - Hannover Office
controls.description: Clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.

controls.name: Clock Synchronisation - HLRA-specific
controls.description: Clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.

controls.name: Use of priviliged utility programs
controls.description: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

controls.name: Installation of software on operational systems
controls.description: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.

controls.name: Network Security
controls.description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

controls.name: Web filtering
controls.description: Web filtering shall be implemented to protect access to external websites with malicious content or content that can be against the organization's acceptable use policies.

controls.name: Use of cryptography
controls.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.

controls.name: Secure development lifecycle
controls.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.

controls.name: Application security requirements
controls.description: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.

controls.name: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
controls.description: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.

controls.name: Secure Coding
controls.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.

controls.name: Security testing in development and acceptance
controls.description: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.

controls.name: Outsourced development
controls.description: The organization shall direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.

controls.name: Separation of development, test and production environments
controls.description: Development, testing and production environments shall be separated and secured.

controls.name: Change Management
controls.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.

controls.name: Test Information *TBC - Placeholder for APRA CPS 234 CO 14 - Control Testing
controls.description: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected and managed.

controls.name: Protection of information systems during audit testing
controls.description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
